speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: SCENE IV. Ephesus. A room in CERIMON's house.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Enter CERIMON and THAISA

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Madam, this letter, and some certain jewels,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Lay with you in your coffer: which are now

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: At your command. Know you the character?

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: It is my lord's.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: That I was shipp'd at sea, I well remember,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Even on my eaning time; but whether there

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Deliver'd, by the holy gods,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: I cannot rightly say. But since King Pericles,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: My wedded lord, I ne'er shall see again,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: A vestal livery will I take me to,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: And never more have joy.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Madam, if this you purpose as ye speak,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Diana's temple is not distant far,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Where you may abide till your date expire.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Moreover, if you please, a niece of mine

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Shall there attend you.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: My recompense is thanks, that's all;

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Yet my good will is great, though the gift small.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Exeunt
